TopicTitle: The need for larger scales of parts

Articles.Content:
One of the biggest things that we (or at least I) desperately need are larger-scale parts. ESPECIALLY wing parts. Making big delta wings out of the smaller wings makes the ship wobbly, unstable, and just plain ugly. RCS ports are great for maneuvering larger spacecrafts, but when you get to REALLY big spacecrafts, we're going to need some really heavy-duty RCS.

What do you guys think?
Absolutely. such a pain in the ass to put so many struts in every wing!
you just pointed out why things are large enough... The physics engine has trouble enough with really big things. No sense making it easier to build such monstrosities.
One of the main problems the physics engine has with monstrosities is the wobbliness and part count, which are thing this would eliminate.

Not entirely, you can end up with larger masses further from the CoM giving basically a long enough lever for the physics to work on making matters worse (the notorious flimsiness of orange tank connections come to mind).

If you want larger wings in the meantime, you could get either the PWings mod or B9 Aerospace.

I wouldn't discount the possibility of general incremental improvements in the aero section either, given the engine/emmisive pass that was included the last update.
